windows.symptom: saa 7130 tv card        I have a 32 bit saa 7130 tv card installed which ran with honestech tvr 2.5 software on windows 7 32 bit. I have installed windows 10 and cannot run card and software. please advise
solutions: Check with the maker of the card to see if they have made new drivers for Windows 10.

Hi Stan. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.You'd need to contact the card manufacturer to see if Windows 10 is supported with drivers, software or patches to make it work.If not you can try installing the driver and software in Compatibility Mode as shown here:https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/win...https://www.groovypost.com/howto/run-old-softwa...If not then you'd need to buy a new TV card or try some of the modern streaming apps which are popular now in Windows 10.I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and keep me posted. If you will wait to choose if I solved your problem, I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

Hi stanholmes,I wish I could help coz I have the same card (I suppose) too.Step 1: Make sure that the card is detected. Sometimes it will show up as Philipps TV card. Right click on that and uninstall. Please also check the 'delete driver software for this device' on the window/dialog box that will pop up.Step 2: Restart your pc and disable the device hardware signature enforcement (I think this is option 7)Step 3: Install your TV tuner with the software that worked with Windows 7. Use 'install driver anyway' when a prompt pop-up.TADA! You're good to go!PS: I turned it of coz snipping tool nor print screen won't capture a live image of the show.Please update me for anything.Regards,John Cyrille Ong
That card is very old. Philips does not support that card on Windows 10.

It works for me sir and I connect it to TV box to watch shows. I also noticed that he is also using honestech tvr 2.5 software which is the same as mine.I also noticed that a lot of people have 'these' kinds of problems after updating to Windows 10. Manufacturer left them out and in my opinion if a driver works for a previous version of Windows then why not try it....I got lucky I guess this time.Cheers!
I got lucky I guess this time.I prefer not to rely on luck.

solutions: Hi WHP. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.See fixes here: https://www.thewindowsclub.com/vcruntime140-dll...You can try to repair Visual C++ here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/i...https://support.solarwinds.com/SuccessCenter/s/article/Repair-Microsoft-C-RedistributableGo into Settings > Apps > Apps & Features to locate versions of the Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables 2015 and/or 2017 and uninstall. windows.symptom: Intel Graphics driver fails to install on fresh Win10 installation        I purchased a new hard drive and installed Windows on it with media creation tool. After window's installation my second monitor is not being detected. It is plugged into my motherboard via HDMI and should be using Intel graphics as the display adapter (doesn't show up in device manager). My main monitor is plugged into my nvidia graphics card. My nvidia drivers are up to date. When I try to install intel graphics manually it says the computer does not meet the minimum requirements... the driver is coming right from my processors support page (here)Other things to note: I've restarted several times, disabled nvidia driver, plugged the second monitor into the graphics card and it works, my old hard drive with the previous installation of windows is still connected to my motherboard.Any suggestions? I've exhausted google's answersEdit: Also if I boot into my old hard drive, the second monitor doesn't work (it was working perfectly fine before installing windows on the new hard drive) And there is no Intel graphics display adapter in the device manager
solutions: Is the Intel card detected in the BIOS/UEFI Setup? Check all tabs. It may need to be enabled there due to a reset.If the Intel display adapter doesn't even appear in Device Manager anywhere then you'll need to reseat the card to try to get it detected.   This is likely the reason it won't install the driver, because the card isn't detected on the System.  Let me know if I'm misunderstanding this.

Xbox Game Pass for PC Beta - Can't select my d: drive to install games        I recently bought the game pass for my pc, but it has a small internal hdd so I normally download apps to my portable hdd and it is selected for all app downloads. When I try to download a game from the game pass only the c: drive shows and not d:.
solutions: Hi FixingPhoenix80, my name is Jay. I'm an independent advisor. I'd be happy to help with your issue.Please try reinstalling gaming services. To do this: Launch powershell as an administrator and enter “get-appxpackage Microsoft.GamingServices | remove-AppxPackage -allusers”In the same powershell window, enter “start ms-windows-store://pdp/?productid=9MWPM2CQNLHN”Install the app on that page, including accepting the UAC prompt when shown. Try installing the game again. Reference: https://beta.support.xbox.com/help/games-apps/t... I hope this helps, please let me know how it goes. Thank you. Regards, Jay ____________________________________________________ Disclaimer: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: switch out of S mode        I follow instructions - go to settings - updates and security - activation - but when I click on store - nothing comes upIf I search on switch out of s mode in the store - I do not get the screen they show in videos - ideas?
solutions: Hi. johnk-z My name is Anthony, an Independent Advisor trying to help. After restarting your computer, try the change process again, doing the following:1. Press the Start button located on the bottom left of your screen. 2. Select the Settings icon, located just above the power icon in the Start menu.3. Select Update and security in the Settings application. 4. Select Activation and then select Go to store. 5. Select the Get option. 6. Then press Install when you are ready to continue. 7. The process to change from S mode is seconds (maybe about five to be exact). You do not need to restart the PC for it to take effect. You can continue and start installing .exe applications now in addition to the Microsoft Store applications.And that is. While Windows 10 in S mode is designed for security and performance, it is not for everyone. Microsoft at least gives you the option to choose which version you prefer.Best Regards. Anthony. -

windows.symptom: Constant OS Crashing/Hardware Failure in Windows Reliability?        Hello all,My PC has been crashing a lot lately, and I am not sure why. In the Reliability Monitor, I took a look and found a lot of hardware errors. Unfortunately, it does not tell me the specific part that failed. Which is what I am hoping you folks can find out for me.Minidump folder:https://1drv.ms/u/s!Al68nZWXDWSshSUoudT_jq5_2AT-?e=SG7BHF
solutions: Hi PickleWeasel425, I am Rob, an independent and a 14 time and dual award MVP specializing in Windows troubleshooting and Bluescreen analysis. Please remember as independents we are not responsible for the development of Windows or the computer hardware and drivers. If you will work with me I will be here to help until the issue is resolved.This one is not likely to be any fun. Troubleshoot blue screen errors <-- read this linkhttp://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/troubleshoot-blue-screen-errors If you are over-clocking anything STOP! (This can both cause BSOD and make troubleshooting impossible.)There were 6 different minidumps (sure wish you had zip'd them all into one zip) - 3 ea. 3B, and 1 ea. 1E, F7, and 7F. Very often a bunch of different BugChecks can mean a hardware problem is the cause.BugCheck 3B, {c0000005, fffff8061aa50d58, ffffec89f5876d60, 0}Probably caused by : memory_corruptionBugCheck 1000007F, {8, ffff9f00c2caf090, 61, fffff80739dc48fc}Probably caused by : memory_corruptionBugCheck 3B, {c0000005, fffff8012bec39ce, ffffe48a36e6e6f0, 0}Probably caused by : FLTMGR.SYS ( FLTMGR!FltpPerformPostCallbacks+1ae ) <-- this is a Windows component which means something else drove it into Fault.BugCheck 3B, {c0000005, fffff8017bba313a, ffff8d823d0de0e0, 0}Probably caused by : Ntfs.sys ( Ntfs!NtfsFindPrefixHashEntry+1fa )  <-- this is a Windows component which means something else drove it into FaultBugCheck 1E, {ffffffffc0000005, fffff8061201fb8d, 0, ffffffffffffffff}Probably caused by : ntkrnlmp.exe ( nt!NtWaitForMultipleObjects+12d )  <-- this is a Windows component which means something else drove it into FaultBugCheck F7, {fffff480c6da76e8, 8126aa3e5f96, ffff7ed955c1a069, 0}Probably caused by : memory_corruptionFurther analysis did not help which probably also often indicates a hardware error.1. Remove ALL power the reseat the cards, memory, and cables (on both ends when possible) - actually remove and replace - do not just snug.2A. Check with ASUStek Support, their on-line docs and drivers, and ask in their forums about any known issues. Update the BIOS, chipset drivers, and all major drivers (see driver update methods below).ASUS - Service <-- includes Live Chat  - Chat Icon is on lower right of pagehttps://www.asus.com/us/support/Download-Center/ASUStek Supporthttps://www.asus.com/support/ASUStek Forums are ZenTalk orROG (Republic of Gamers)ZenTalkhttps://www.asus.com/zentalk/portal.php?nocache=1ROG - Republic of Gamershttps://rog.asus.com/forum/?_ga=2.79315284.1301934212.1566869491-425645307.1554009500ASUStek Drivershttps://www.asus.com/us/support/Download-Center/2B. Even though the Nvidia drivers are very current they could still be involved. And it may be necessary to revert to an older stable versions. Ask their Support and Forums for known issues, nvlddmkm.sys dated 12/24/2019 Nvidia video drivers.Nvidia - Drivers - Use OPTION 1 to manually enter your driver info to get most current drivers. http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx?lang=en-usNvidia Support - check with Support as it could be a known issuehttp://www.nvidia.com/page/support.htmlNvidia Forums - also check for forums as it could be a known issue and/or others likely to have ithttp://forums.nvidia.com/2C. Check for update to the Razer drivers and ask about known issues.Razer Support & Communityhttp://www.razersupport.com/3. Run the memory tests (see methods below).4. Sometimes it helps to reduce the system down to as simple as possible - remove all devices you boot without and use minimum memory.5. Since this does seem to be hardware, which can't be confirmed with software, try using the Stress Tests below to see if that helps identify the issue (of course NO over-clocking).PC Stress Test free software for Windows 10https://www.thewindowsclub.com/pc-stress-test-free-software6. As needed use ALL the methods in the troubleshooters below.7. After ALL the above if needed run Driver Verifier to see if it can indicate a CAUSE (see Driver Verifier methods below).-----------------------------------------------------------Troubleshoot blue screen errors <-- read this linkhttp://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/troubleshoot-blue-screen-errors==================================================This utility makes it easy to see which versions are loaded : Run DriverView - set VIEW to Hide Microsoft drivers - update those without Dump in their names (and update BIOS and chipset drivers).DriverView - Free - utility displays the list of all device drivers currently loaded on your system. For each driver in the list, additional useful information is displayed: load address of the driver, description, version, product name, company that created the driver, and more.http://www.nirsoft.net/utils/driverview.html  For Drivers check System Maker as fallbacks and Device Maker's which are the most current. Right Click the Start Button - Device Manager - Display Adapter - write down the make and complete model of your video adapter - double click - Driver's tab - write down the version info. Now click UPdate Driver (this may not do anything as MS is far behind certifying drivers) - then Right Click - Uninstall - REBOOT this will refresh the driver stack.Repeat that for Network - Network Card (NIC), Wifi, Sound, Mouse and Keyboard if 3rd party with their own software and drivers and any other major device drivers you have.Now go to System Maker's site (Dell, HP, Toshiba as examples) (as rollback) and then Device Maker's site (Realtek, Intel, Nvidia, ATI as examples) and get their latest versions. (Look for BIOS, Chipset, and software updates at System Maker's site while there.)Download - SAVE - go to where you put them - Right Click - RUN AD ADMIN - REBOOT after each installation.Always check in Device Manager - Drivers tab to be sure the version you are installing actually shows up. This is because some drivers rollback before the latest is installed (sound drivers particularly do this) so install a driver - reboot - check to be sure it is installed and repeat as needed.Repeat at Device Makers - BTW at Device Makers DO NOT RUN THEIR SCANNER - check manually by model.Manually look at manufacturer's sites for drivers - and Device Maker's sites.http://pcsupport.about.com/od/driverssupport/ht/driverdlmfgr.htm    ====================================================Memory tests do not catch all errors such as mismatched memory (possible even for sticks that appear to be identical) and when faster memory is placed in the system behind slower memory. So it is best to also swap sticks in and out to check for those even if all memory tests fail to show a problem.To test RAM check here - let it run 4+ hours or so.  <-- best methodwww.memtest.orgMemTestX86 - Test RAM Withhttp://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/14201-memtest86-test-ram.htmlFor the Windows Memory Diagnostic Tool.Type in Cortana's search box ->  Windows Memory Diagnostics  ........find at top of the list - click it. in Windows 8/8.1/10 the name is "Windows Memory Diagnostic".================================================After doing ALL the updates you can, and if the issue continues, then run Driver Verifier. Driver Verifier can help find some BSOD issues : Using Driver Verifier to identify issues with Windows drivers for advanced usershttp://support.microsoft.com/kb/244617How To Troubleshoot Driver Problems in Windows Vista or 7. (8/8.1 and 10 are essentially the same).http://www.winvistaclub.com/t79.htmlUsing Driver Verifierhttps://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/hardware/ff545448%28v=vs.85%29.aspx?f=255&MSPPError=-2147217396  WINKEY + X - RUN - type in -> verifier /reset      hit enter to disableIf Driver Verifier creates a minidump upload it and post the link here so we can analyze it.Here to help,Rob------Standard Disclaimer: Those may be non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.Please let us know the results and if you need further assistance. Feedback definitely helps us help all.

windows.symptom: printer problem        I have windows 7 and have bought a new printer I have connected it wirelessly but it will not print out
solutions: Have you installed the Windows 7 driver for it? Please describe your problem in more detail. Tell us what "it will not print out"means. Exactly how are you trying? From what program? Do you see it in the list of printers in that program when you go to the print dialog? What happens when you try? If you get an error message, please quote it verbatim.

Have you installed the Windows 7 driver for it? Please describe your problem in more detail. Tell us what "it will not print out"means. Exactly how are you trying? From what program? Do you see it in the list of printers in that program when you go to the print dialog? What happens when you try? If you get an error message, please quote it verbatim.Hi Ken I have a Samsung RV511 (2015) Laptop and have bought a HP DeskJet 2600 All-in-one Wireless Printer  I have connected it up wirelessly and the printer shows that it is connected but when I send my work from windows to print it does not print out but it shows that it is in the queue to be printed.willi

I have windows 7 and have bought a new printer I have connected it wirelessly but it will not print out As you have the Drivers installed and the computer sees the Printer.Check your Services.Go to the Start Orb.Type in : services and press the Enter Key.Scroll down to Print Spooler and make sure that this service is set to : Started ( under Status ) @ Automatic under ( Startup Type ). Remove all the Cued / Pending print jobs as well BUT make sure that you have a backup of those you want to print out.You may have to Stop the Print Spooler to do this.Also have a read through the below HP Link :https://support.hp.com/au-en/document/c05367434

windows.symptom: Is  it safe to buy Windows from "keysbundle.com"        Hi can anyone tell me if it is safe to buy widows from keysbundle .com ?
solutions: Hi Mr. Afridi,I am Sumit, an Independent Advisor and a 3 year Windows Insider MVP here to help.We do not recommend buying keys from a 3rd party seller. They are selling the keys at way too much cheaper price which means likely the keys would stop working in future.https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/howtotell/Shop....Beware of Product Keys Sold Separately With the exception of Product Key Cards (PKC’s) distributed with COA’s, Microsoft does not distribute products keys as standalone products. If you see a listing on an auction site, online classified ad, or other online page advertising product keys for sale, it’s a good indication that the keys are likely stolen or counterfeit. If you were to purchase and use a stolen or counterfeit product key to activate Windows installed on your PC, the key may not work for activation, may already be in use on another PC, or it might be blocked from use later by Microsoft when the key is reported stolen.

MOUSE bug - Wacom pen + tablet        https://imgur.com/a/zzmMqUyI am having an issue where after a minute or two, (never immediately), after using my drawing tablet, Windows decides to increase my cursor size seeminglybeyond  the maximum size in Settings.My setup is as follows:Wacom Intuos 2  (XD-1212-U)Windows 10 1903Drawing program used is Paint Tool Sai.I have already uninstalled the drivers and reinstalled them, the photos linked above were taken after several minutes of using Paint Tool Sai after having just rebooted today.I do not believe the device itself is to fault, however, device manager only has a generic listing for the drawing tablet:  "HID-Compliant Digitizer"I can however find the device, listed by model, in windows settings.Even if the device (drivers) is no longer supported, surely I should be able to stop the cursor from supersizing during use.I have never seen the generic windows touch interface do anything similar to this, so why should my input device?I have previously disabled all windows ink and pen / gesture settings where I can find them, but can no longer find these settings in 1903.My question is how do I stop the cursor supersizing?
solutions: Hello LavendARSE ! My name is Marco, I am an Independent Advisor. I will do my best to help you.You can adjust the size of your cursor by following this path Right click on the windows start button Click on SETTNGS Then click on DEVICE And right click on MOUSE And on the far right "Adjust mouse & cursor size" You will now see the options to change the size of the cursor

windows.symptom: My hp laser jet P-1005 not working properly when open ON        Dear Sir,1. I am using windows 7 ultimate, problem is when I start  my above named printer first time,and want to print something, he dose not print, until I open Services and go toPrint Spool and stop and start the services,and go to windows\system32\spool\PRINTER and then delete my stuck print job.2. After that above process, I do my Printer OFF and  ON  once again, now he dose print many time until I switched OFF.I have deleted and re-installed many time printer driver from hp-site, but I am facing same above problem..I thing that windows 7  operating system not supporting, HP-Laser jet P-1005 printer but my other friends using that printerand same driver successfully.. kindly any one solved my problem, I would be highly appreciated ....best regards.anees khan
solutions: Windows 7 does support this printer.HP Link below.https://support.hp.com/us-en/drivers/selfservice/hp-laserjet-p1005-printer/3435674Just make sure you have the correct one installed as to 32 Bit or 64 Bit.Also :Is the Print Spooler set to Automatic and Started ???Diag below.Cued up or pending print jobs may also cause issues at times.HP Link below.https://support.hp.com/au-en/document/c00381778
